message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) category as it deals with the task of recommending items to users based on their past preferences. It also involves the use of machine learning techniques such as Hidden Markov Models (HMM) which are commonly used in information retrieval tasks. 

The paper also involves the use of non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) which is a popular technique in machine learning and falls under the category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). 

The use of HMMs and NMFs for recommendation tasks involves the use of artificial intelligence techniques and hence the paper is also likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category. 

The paper also involves the analysis of sequential behavior of users and the detection of change points in user preferences. This falls under the category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) which deals with the analysis of social networks and user behavior. 

Finally, the paper involves the evaluation of the proposed models using a real music streaming dataset which falls under the category of Computation and Language (cs.CL) which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics.
